alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 2:59PM EST until January 27 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 157 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing locally heavy rainfall across coastal portions of Okaloosa County. 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen in the past hour and additional locally heavy rainfall may result in minor flooding, especially in the typical lower lying locations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wright, Fort Walton Beach, Destin, Eglin AFB, Valparaiso, Mary Esther, Lake Lorraine, Ocean City, Shalimar, Cinco Bayou, Eglin Village, Postil, Longwood and Seminole. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
